result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Jesse Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence Jesse Thomas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence Jesse Thomas was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser  DF ATTY: Daniel P Repka DF: Lawrence Jesse Thomas appeared from jail. Case called at 10:02. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Repka agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CM301. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CM301. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM301. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders: Impose 5 months St. Croix County Jail to be served concurrently with present sentence. Set for review in 6 mo. for financials.

Conditions of ES:
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Random and regular testing. 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- $508 Costs 
- With additional Costs of supervision.
- Maintain employment.

Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 11:45 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Katie T. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Jeremiah Harrelson,  DF:  Lawrence Jesse Thomas appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Defendant is on a PO hold.  State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing. Defendant does not qualify for PD - PFAC.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 11:45 am.
